intro: Castilleja bryantii var. socorrensis, commonly known as the Socorro milkvetch, is a hemiparasitic flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family and is characterized by its bright red or orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has slender, branched stems and small, narrow leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in desert or semi-arid environments. Castilleja bryantii var. socorrensis plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar to pollinators and serving as a host for certain insects.
